definition.text: Encapsulates different data providers able to read datasets organized in different ways.

paragraphs.text: The system defines these types of data providers:
Market Files: For time-frames of 1 hour and above, it is convenient to have a single file with all the data of the whole market.
Daily Files: For time-frames below 1 hour, up to 1 minute, it is convenient to split market data into one file per day.
Single File: Sometimes a process may generate a single file irrespective of the time-frame.
Files Sequence: Some processes may produce a sequence of files.
Daily Files are managed by a File Cursor which dynamically loads the files of one day and its neighboring days.
